moves.1. e4:
What Happened There?

Ever been quite content and then suddenly.....
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. Bc4: I like d6 as the black response. Makes it much easier for me.....
Not sure why he did that, I assumed a mistake, though to be honest his options were somewhat limited.
moves.17. Qxg4 Qd6 18. Rab1: Wanting to move the knight out....
Trying to force a queen exchange....
moves.26... Qd7 27. Kg2 Bf6 28. Qe3 d4: If he'd backed up ahead there that would have been an excellent move, as it is its escapable.
moves.29. Qd2 Qxf5 30. Nd1 Rd8 31. Rf2 Qg4+ 32: Oh how I swore. Either I sacrifice the queen or I take mate in one. And that in a match I was feeling quite comfortable in. The dangers of complacency eh?
